article.description: Boise State holds on to beat Houston 75-73 in OT
article.headline: Boise State holds on to beat Houston 75-73 in OT
article.linkText: Boise State holds on to beat Houston 75-73 in OT
article.story: LAS VEGAS -- Igor Hadziomerovic stole the ball at midcourt and drove for a layup with 45 seconds left to secure a 75-73 overtime victory over Houston in the Las Vegas Classic on Monday night. The Broncos then made three free throws to hold off the Cougars for the win. Derrick Marks scored 14 points, Mike Thompson 13 and Hadziomerovic and Rob Heyer 11 apiece for Boise State (10-2). The Broncos, who have won six straight, will play Loyola of Chicago for the championship Tuesday. Houston will face Texas Tech for third place. Boise State led throughout most of the second half but Jherrod Stiggers' 3-pointer gave Houston a 55-54 lead with 4:36 left. The Broncos grabbed the lead back, but LeRon Barnes tipped in Stiggers' missed 3 to tie the game at 62 and send it into overtime. Devonta Pollard had 12 points, Stiggers 11 and Barnes 10 for Houston (5-4).

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
